root_text.mn133:1.2: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharati tapodārāme.
root_text.mn133:1.3: Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya yena tapodo tenupasaṅkami gattāni parisiñcituṁ.
root_text.mn133:1.4: Tapode gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsi gattāni pubbāpayamāno.
root_text.mn133:1.5: Atha kho aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṁ tapodaṁ obhāsetvā yenāyasmā samiddhi tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho sā devatā āyasmantaṁ samiddhiṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn133:2.2: “Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, dhāremi bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca.
root_text.mn133:2.3: Tvaṁ panāvuso, dhāresi bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañcā”ti?
root_text.mn133:2.4: “Ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na dhāremi bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca.
root_text.mn133:2.5: Dhāresi pana tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattiyo gāthā”ti?
root_text.mn133:2.6: “Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, dhāremi bhaddekarattiyo gāthāti.
root_text.mn133:2.8: “Ahampi kho, bhikkhu na dhāremi bhaddekarattiyo gāthāti.
root_text.mn133:2.9: Uggaṇhāhi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca;
root_text.mn133:2.10: pariyāpuṇāhi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca;
root_text.mn133:2.11: dhārehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca.
root_text.mn133:2.12: Atthasaṁhito, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddeso ca vibhaṅgo ca ādibrahmacariyako”ti.
root_text.mn133:3.1: Atha kho āyasmā samiddhi tassā rattiyā accayena yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho āyasmā samiddhi bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn133:3.2: “Idhāhaṁ, bhante, rattiyā paccūsasamayaṁ paccuṭṭhāya yena tapodo tenupasaṅkamiṁ gattāni parisiñcituṁ.
root_text.mn133:3.3: Tapode gattāni parisiñcitvā paccuttaritvā ekacīvaro aṭṭhāsiṁ gattāni pubbāpayamāno.
root_text.mn133:3.4: Atha kho bhante, aññatarā devatā abhikkantāya rattiyā abhikkantavaṇṇā kevalakappaṁ tapodaṁ obhāsetvā yenāhaṁ tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā ekamantaṁ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṁ ṭhitā kho sā devatā maṁ etadavoca:
root_text.mn133:4.1: Evaṁ vutte, ahaṁ, bhante, taṁ devataṁ etadavocaṁ:
root_text.mn133:4.2: ‘na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, dhāremi bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca.
root_text.mn133:4.3: Tvaṁ panāvuso, dhāresi bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañcā’ti?
root_text.mn133:4.4: ‘Ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na dhāremi bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca.
root_text.mn133:4.5: Dhāresi pana tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattiyo gāthā’ti?
root_text.mn133:4.6: ‘Na kho ahaṁ, āvuso, dhāremi bhaddekarattiyo gāthāti.
root_text.mn133:4.8: ‘Ahampi kho, bhikkhu, na dhāremi bhaddekarattiyo gāthāti.
root_text.mn133:4.9: Uggaṇhāhi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca;
root_text.mn133:4.10: pariyāpuṇāhi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca;
root_text.mn133:4.11: dhārehi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca.
root_text.mn133:4.12: Atthasaṁhito, bhikkhu, bhaddekarattassa uddeso ca vibhaṅgo ca ādibrahmacariyako’ti.
root_text.mn133:4.15: Sādhu me, bhante, bhagavā bhaddekarattassa uddesañca vibhaṅgañca desetū”ti.
root_text.mn133:4.16: “Tena hi, bhikkhu, suṇāhi, sādhukaṁ manasi karohi; bhāsissāmī”ti.
root_text.mn133:4.17: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho āyasmā samiddhi bhagavato paccassosi.
root_text.mn133:6.2: idaṁ vatvāna sugato uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ pāvisi.
root_text.mn133:7.1: Atha kho tesaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ, acirapakkantassa bhagavato, etadahosi:
root_text.mn133:7.2: “idaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:7.19: Ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajeyyā”ti?
root_text.mn133:7.21: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ;
root_text.mn133:7.22: pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
root_text.mn133:7.23: Yannūna mayaṁ yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāmā”ti.
root_text.mn133:7.24: Atha kho te bhikkhū yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmatā mahākaccānena saddhiṁ sammodiṁsu.
root_text.mn133:7.25: Sammodanīyaṁ kathaṁ sāraṇīyaṁ vītisāretvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.mn133:7.26: “idaṁ kho no, āvuso kaccāna, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:7.31: Tesaṁ no, āvuso kaccāna, amhākaṁ, acirapakkantassa bhagavato, etadahosi—
root_text.mn133:7.32: idaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:8.1: Ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajeyyāti?
root_text.mn133:8.2: Tesaṁ no, āvuso kaccāna, amhākaṁ etadahosi:
root_text.mn133:8.3: ‘ayaṁ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
root_text.mn133:8.4: Pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
root_text.mn133:8.5: Yannūna mayaṁ yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāmā’ti.
root_text.mn133:9.1: “Seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso sāratthiko sāragavesī sārapariyesanaṁ caramāno mahato rukkhassa tiṭṭhato sāravato atikkammeva mūlaṁ atikkamma khandhaṁ sākhāpalāse sāraṁ pariyesitabbaṁ maññeyya;
root_text.mn133:9.2: evaṁsampadamidaṁ āyasmantānaṁ satthari sammukhībhūte taṁ bhagavantaṁ atisitvā amhe etamatthaṁ paṭipucchitabbaṁ maññatha.
root_text.mn133:9.3: So hāvuso, bhagavā jānaṁ jānāti, passaṁ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhammassāmī tathāgato.
root_text.mn133:9.4: So ceva panetassa kālo ahosi yaṁ bhagavantaṁyeva etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyātha, yathā vo bhagavā byākareyya tathā naṁ dhāreyyāthā”ti.
root_text.mn133:10.1: “Addhāvuso kaccāna, bhagavā jānaṁ jānāti, passaṁ passati, cakkhubhūto ñāṇabhūto dhammabhūto brahmabhūto vattā pavattā atthassa ninnetā amatassa dātā dhammassāmī tathāgato.
root_text.mn133:10.2: So ceva panetassa kālo ahosi yaṁ bhagavantaṁyeva etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāma;
root_text.mn133:10.3: yathā no bhagavā byākareyya tathā naṁ dhāreyyāma.
root_text.mn133:10.4: Api cāyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ;
root_text.mn133:10.5: pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
root_text.mn133:11.1: “Tena hāvuso, suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
root_text.mn133:11.2: “Evamāvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākaccānassa paccassosuṁ.
root_text.mn133:12.1: “Yaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:12.6: Imassa kho ahaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi—
root_text.mn133:13.2: Iti me cakkhu ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti rūpāti—
root_text.mn133:13.3: tattha chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa tadabhinandati, tadabhinandanto atītaṁ anvāgameti.
root_text.mn133:13.4: Iti me sotaṁ ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti saddāti …pe…
root_text.mn133:13.5: iti me ghānaṁ ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti gandhāti …
root_text.mn133:13.6: iti me jivhā ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti rasāti …
root_text.mn133:13.7: iti me kāyo ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti phoṭṭhabbāti …
root_text.mn133:13.8: iti me mano ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti dhammāti—
root_text.mn133:13.9: tattha chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa tadabhinandati, tadabhinandanto atītaṁ anvāgameti—
root_text.mn133:14.2: Iti me cakkhu ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti rūpāti—
root_text.mn133:14.3: tattha na chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, na chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa na tadabhinandati, na tadabhinandanto atītaṁ nānvāgameti.
root_text.mn133:14.4: Iti me sotaṁ ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti saddāti …pe…
root_text.mn133:14.5: iti me ghānaṁ ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti gandhāti …
root_text.mn133:14.6: iti me jivhā ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti rasāti …
root_text.mn133:14.7: iti me kāyo ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti phoṭṭhabbāti …
root_text.mn133:14.8: iti me mano ahosi atītamaddhānaṁ iti dhammāti—
root_text.mn133:14.9: tattha na chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, na chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa, na tadabhinandati, na tadabhinandanto atītaṁ nānvāgameti—
root_text.mn133:15.2: Iti me cakkhu siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti rūpāti—
root_text.mn133:15.3: appaṭiladdhassa paṭilābhāya cittaṁ paṇidahati, cetaso paṇidhānapaccayā tadabhinandati, tadabhinandanto anāgataṁ paṭikaṅkhati.
root_text.mn133:15.4: Iti me sotaṁ siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti saddāti …pe…
root_text.mn133:15.5: iti me ghānaṁ siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti gandhāti …
root_text.mn133:15.6: iti me jivhā siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti rasāti …
root_text.mn133:15.7: iti me kāyo siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti phoṭṭhabbāti …
root_text.mn133:15.8: iti me mano siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti dhammāti—
root_text.mn133:15.9: appaṭiladdhassa paṭilābhāya cittaṁ paṇidahati, cetaso paṇidhānapaccayā tadabhinandati, tadabhinandanto anāgataṁ paṭikaṅkhati—
root_text.mn133:16.2: Iti me cakkhu siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti rūpāti—
root_text.mn133:16.3: appaṭiladdhassa paṭilābhāya cittaṁ nappaṇidahati, cetaso appaṇidhānapaccayā na tadabhinandati, na tadabhinandanto anāgataṁ nappaṭikaṅkhati.
root_text.mn133:16.4: Iti me sotaṁ siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti saddāti …pe…
root_text.mn133:16.5: iti me ghānaṁ siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti gandhāti …
root_text.mn133:16.6: iti me jivhā siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti rasāti …
root_text.mn133:16.7: iti me kāyo siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti phoṭṭhabbāti …
root_text.mn133:16.8: iti me mano siyā anāgatamaddhānaṁ iti dhammāti—
root_text.mn133:16.9: appaṭiladdhassa paṭilābhāya cittaṁ nappaṇidahati, cetaso appaṇidhānapaccayā na tadabhinandati, na tadabhinandanto anāgataṁ nappaṭikaṅkhati—
root_text.mn133:17.4: Tasmiñce paccuppanne chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa tadabhinandati, tadabhinandanto paccuppannesu dhammesu saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn133:17.7: yā cāvuso, jivhā ye ca rasā …
root_text.mn133:17.8: yo cāvuso, kāyo ye ca phoṭṭhabbā …
root_text.mn133:17.9: yo cāvuso, mano ye ca dhammā—
root_text.mn133:17.11: Tasmiñce paccuppanne chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa tadabhinandati, tadabhinandanto paccuppannesu dhammesu saṁhīrati—
root_text.mn133:17.12: evaṁ kho, āvuso, paccuppannesu dhammesu saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn133:18.1: Kathañca, āvuso, paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati?
root_text.mn133:18.4: Tasmiñce paccuppanne na chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, na chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa na tadabhinandati, na tadabhinandanto paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn133:18.7: yā cāvuso, jivhā ye ca rasā …
root_text.mn133:18.8: yo cāvuso, kāyo ye ca phoṭṭhabbā …
root_text.mn133:18.9: yo cāvuso, mano ye ca dhammā—
root_text.mn133:18.11: Tasmiñce paccuppanne na chandarāgappaṭibaddhaṁ hoti viññāṇaṁ, na chandarāgappaṭibaddhattā viññāṇassa na tadabhinandati, na tadabhinandanto paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati—
root_text.mn133:18.12: evaṁ kho, āvuso, paccuppannesu dhammesu na saṁhīrati.
root_text.mn133:19.1: Yaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:19.6: Imassa kho ahaṁ, āvuso, bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa evaṁ vitthārena atthaṁ ājānāmi.
root_text.mn133:19.7: Ākaṅkhamānā ca pana tumhe āyasmanto bhagavantaṁyeva upasaṅkamitvā etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyātha,
root_text.mn133:19.8: yathā vo bhagavā byākaroti tathā naṁ dhāreyyāthā”ti.
root_text.mn133:20.1: Atha kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahākaccānassa bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu. Ekamantaṁ nisinnā kho te bhikkhū bhagavantaṁ etadavocuṁ:
root_text.mn133:20.2: “yaṁ kho no, bhante, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:20.7: Tesaṁ no, bhante, amhākaṁ, acirapakkantassa bhagavato, etadahosi:
root_text.mn133:20.8: ‘idaṁ kho no, āvuso, bhagavā saṅkhittena uddesaṁ uddisitvā vitthārena atthaṁ avibhajitvā uṭṭhāyāsanā vihāraṁ paviṭṭho:
root_text.mn133:20.25: Ko nu kho imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajeyyā’ti?
root_text.mn133:20.27: ‘ayaṁ kho āyasmā mahākaccāno satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ.
root_text.mn133:20.28: Pahoti cāyasmā mahākaccāno imassa bhagavatā saṅkhittena uddesassa uddiṭṭhassa vitthārena atthaṁ avibhattassa vitthārena atthaṁ vibhajituṁ.
root_text.mn133:20.29: Yannūna mayaṁ yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkameyyāma; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyāmā’ti.
root_text.mn133:20.30: Atha kho mayaṁ, bhante, yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkamimha; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṁ mahākaccānaṁ etamatthaṁ paṭipucchimha.
root_text.mn133:20.31: Tesaṁ no, bhante, āyasmatā mahākaccānena imehi ākārehi imehi padehi imehi byañjanehi attho vibhatto”ti.
root_text.mn133:21.2: Mañcepi tumhe, bhikkhave, etamatthaṁ paṭipuccheyyātha, ahampi taṁ evamevaṁ byākareyyaṁ yathā taṁ mahākaccānena byākataṁ.
root_text.mn133:21.3: Eso cevetassa attho. Evañca naṁ dhārethā”ti.
root_text.mn133:21.5: Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.

translation_text.mn133:1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha in the Hot Springs Monastery.
translation_text.mn133:1.3: Then Venerable Samiddhi rose at the crack of dawn and went to the hot springs to bathe.
translation_text.mn133:1.4: When he had bathed and emerged from the water he stood in one robe drying himself.
translation_text.mn133:1.5: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire hot springs, went up to Samiddhi, stood to one side, and said to Samiddhi:
translation_text.mn133:2.1: “Mendicant, do you remember the recitation passage and analysis of One Fine Night?”
translation_text.mn133:2.5: But do you remember just the verses on One Fine Night?”
translation_text.mn133:2.9: Learn the recitation passage and analysis of One Fine Night, mendicant,
translation_text.mn133:2.12: It is beneficial and relates to the fundamentals of the spiritual life.”
translation_text.mn133:3.1: Then, when the night had passed, Samiddhi went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened. Then he added:
translation_text.mn133:4.15: “Sir, please teach me the recitation passage and analysis of One Fine night.”
translation_text.mn133:4.16: “Well then, mendicant, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
translation_text.mn133:5.6: are clearly seen in every case.
translation_text.mn133:5.9: Today’s the day to keenly work—
translation_text.mn133:5.10: who knows, tomorrow may bring death!
translation_text.mn133:5.11: For there is no bargain to be struck
translation_text.mn133:5.12: with Death and his mighty hordes.
translation_text.mn133:5.13: The peaceful sage explained it’s those
translation_text.mn133:5.16: who truly have that one fine night.”
translation_text.mn133:6.1: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn133:6.2: When he had spoken, the Holy One got up from his seat and entered his dwelling.
translation_text.mn133:7.1: Soon after the Buddha left, those mendicants considered,
translation_text.mn133:7.2: “The Buddha gave this brief passage for recitation, then entered his dwelling without explaining the meaning in detail. …
translation_text.mn133:7.19: Who can explain in detail the meaning of this brief summary given by the Buddha?”
translation_text.mn133:7.21: “This Venerable Mahākaccāna is praised by the Buddha and esteemed by his sensible spiritual companions.
translation_text.mn133:7.22: He is capable of explaining in detail the meaning of this brief passage for recitation given by the Buddha.
translation_text.mn133:7.23: Let’s go to him, and ask him about this matter.”
translation_text.mn133:7.24: Then those mendicants went to Mahākaccāna, and exchanged greetings with him.
translation_text.mn133:7.25: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, they sat down to one side. They told him what had happened, and said:
translation_text.mn133:9.1: “Reverends, suppose there was a person in need of heartwood. And while wandering in search of heartwood he’d come across a large tree standing with heartwood. But he’d pass over the roots and trunk, imagining that the heartwood should be sought in the branches and leaves.
translation_text.mn133:9.2: Such is the consequence for the venerables. Though you were face to face with the Buddha, you overlooked him, imagining that you should ask me about this matter.
translation_text.mn133:9.3: For he is the Buddha, the one who knows and sees. He is vision, he is knowledge, he is the manifestation of principle, he is the manifestation of divinity. He is the teacher, the proclaimer, the elucidator of meaning, the bestower of the deathless, the lord of truth, the Realized One.
translation_text.mn133:9.4: That was the time to approach the Buddha and ask about this matter. You should have remembered it in line with the Buddha’s answer.”
translation_text.mn133:10.1: “Certainly he is the Buddha, the one who knows and sees. He is vision, he is knowledge, he is the manifestation of principle, he is the manifestation of divinity. He is the teacher, the proclaimer, the elucidator of meaning, the bestower of the deathless, the lord of truth, the Realized One.
translation_text.mn133:10.2: That was the time to approach the Buddha and ask about this matter.
translation_text.mn133:10.3: We should have remembered it in line with the Buddha’s answer.
translation_text.mn133:10.4: Still, Venerable Mahākaccāna is praised by the Buddha and esteemed by his sensible spiritual companions.
translation_text.mn133:10.5: He is capable of explaining in detail the meaning of this brief passage for recitation given by the Buddha.
translation_text.mn133:10.6: Please explain this, if it’s no trouble.”
translation_text.mn133:11.1: “Well then, reverends, listen and apply your mind well, I will speak.”
translation_text.mn133:12.1: “Reverends, the Buddha gave this brief passage for recitation, then entered his dwelling without explaining the meaning in detail:
translation_text.mn133:12.5: who truly have that one fine night.’
translation_text.mn133:12.6: And this is how I understand the detailed meaning of this passage for recitation.
translation_text.mn133:13.1: And how do you run back to the past?
translation_text.mn133:13.2: Consciousness gets tied up there with desire and lust, thinking: ‘In the past I had such eyes and such sights.’
translation_text.mn133:13.3: So you take pleasure in that, and that’s when you run back to the past.
translation_text.mn133:13.4: Consciousness gets tied up there with desire and lust, thinking: ‘In the past I had such ears and such sounds …
translation_text.mn133:13.5: such a nose and such smells …
translation_text.mn133:13.6: such a tongue and such tastes …
translation_text.mn133:13.7: such a body and such touches …
translation_text.mn133:13.8: such a mind and such ideas.’
translation_text.mn133:13.9: So you take pleasure in that, and that’s when you run back to the past.
translation_text.mn133:13.10: That’s how you run back to the past.
translation_text.mn133:14.1: And how do you not run back to the past?
translation_text.mn133:14.2: Consciousness doesn’t get tied up there with desire and lust, thinking: ‘In the past I had such eyes and such sights.’
translation_text.mn133:14.3: So you don’t take pleasure in that, and that’s when you no longer run back to the past.
translation_text.mn133:14.4: Consciousness doesn’t get tied up there with desire and lust, thinking: ‘In the past I had such ears and such sounds …
translation_text.mn133:14.5: such a nose and such smells …
translation_text.mn133:14.6: such a tongue and such tastes …
translation_text.mn133:14.7: such a body and such touches …
translation_text.mn133:14.8: such a mind and such ideas.’
translation_text.mn133:14.9: So you don’t take pleasure in that, and that’s when you no longer run back to the past.
translation_text.mn133:14.10: That’s how you don’t run back to the past.
translation_text.mn133:15.1: And how do you hope for the future?
translation_text.mn133:15.2: The heart is set on getting what it does not have, thinking: ‘May I have such eyes and such sights in the future.’
translation_text.mn133:15.3: So you take pleasure in that, and that’s when you hope for the future.
translation_text.mn133:15.4: The heart is set on getting what it does not have, thinking: ‘May I have such ears and such sounds …
translation_text.mn133:15.5: such a nose and such smells …
translation_text.mn133:15.6: such a tongue and such tastes …
translation_text.mn133:15.7: such a body and such touches …
translation_text.mn133:15.8: such a mind and such ideas in the future.’
translation_text.mn133:15.9: So you take pleasure in that, and that’s when you hope for the future.
translation_text.mn133:15.10: That’s how you hope for the future.
translation_text.mn133:16.1: And how do you not hope for the future?
translation_text.mn133:16.2: The heart is not set on getting what it does not have, thinking: ‘May I have such eyes and such sights in the future.’
translation_text.mn133:16.3: So you don’t take pleasure in that, and that’s when you no longer hope for the future.
translation_text.mn133:16.4: The heart is not set on getting what it does not have, thinking: ‘May I have such ears and such sounds …
translation_text.mn133:16.5: such a nose and such smells …
translation_text.mn133:16.6: such a tongue and such tastes …
translation_text.mn133:16.7: such a body and such touches …
translation_text.mn133:16.8: such a mind and such ideas in the future.’
translation_text.mn133:16.9: So you don’t take pleasure in that, and that’s when you no longer hope for the future.
translation_text.mn133:16.10: That’s how you don’t hope for the future.
translation_text.mn133:17.1: And how do you falter amid presently arisen phenomena?
translation_text.mn133:17.4: If consciousness gets tied up there in the present with desire and lust, you take pleasure in that, and that’s when you falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn133:17.11: If consciousness gets tied up there in the present with desire and lust, you take pleasure in that, and that’s when you falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn133:17.12: That’s how you falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn133:18.1: And how do you not falter amid presently arisen phenomena?
translation_text.mn133:18.4: If consciousness doesn’t get tied up there in the present with desire and lust, you don’t take pleasure in that, and that’s when you no longer falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn133:18.11: If consciousness doesn’t get tied up there in the present with desire and lust, you don’t take pleasure in that, and that’s when you no longer falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn133:18.12: That’s how you don’t falter amid presently arisen phenomena.
translation_text.mn133:19.1: This is how I understand the detailed meaning of that brief passage for recitation given by the Buddha.
translation_text.mn133:19.7: If you wish, you may go to the Buddha and ask him about this.
translation_text.mn133:19.8: You should remember it in line with the Buddha’s answer.”
translation_text.mn133:20.1: Then those mendicants, approving and agreeing with what Mahākaccāna said, rose from their seats and went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and told him what had happened, adding:
translation_text.mn133:20.31: “Mahākaccāna clearly explained the meaning to us in this manner, with these words and phrases.”
translation_text.mn133:21.1: “Mahākaccāna is astute, mendicants, he has great wisdom.
translation_text.mn133:21.2: If you came to me and asked this question, I would answer it in exactly the same way as Mahākaccāna.
translation_text.mn133:21.3: That is what it means, and that’s how you should remember it.”
translation_text.mn133:21.4: That is what the Buddha said.
translation_text.mn133:21.5: Satisfied, the mendicants approved what the Buddha said.

reference_text.mn133:13.1: cck14.336, ms11M_832, msdiv282, ndp11.272, nya13, pts-vp-pli3.196
reference_text.mn133:15.1: cck14.337, csp1ed11.237, csp2ed11.237, ms11M_834, msdiv283, nya15, pts-vp-pli3.197
reference_text.mn133:18.1: csp1ed11.238, csp2ed11.238, ms11M_837, nya18, pts-vp-pli3.198, sya14.366
